meanings.definition: To transfer goods from one ship or mode of transportation to another for further shipment.
meanings.sent1: The workers were transshipping the cargo from the boat to the truck.
meanings.sent2: The company transshipped the products from the train to the plane for international delivery.
meanings.sent3: The pirates tried transshipping the treasure, but it ended up in the wrong hands!
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was transshipping her emotions from one person to another, never truly dealing with them.
meanings.sent5: The image of the crane transshipping the containers onto the ship was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring goods from one vessel to another for further transportation.
meanings.sent1: The transshipping of goods between ships was done efficiently at the port.
meanings.sent2: The transshipping of cargo at sea is a common practice to optimize logistics.
meanings.sent3: The comedy sketch about transshipping goods had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a busy port, constantly transshipping thoughts from one ship to another.
meanings.sent5: The transshipping operation at the harbor was a synchronized dance of cranes and containers.

meanings.definition: The process of moving goods from one place to another for further distribution.
meanings.sent1: The transshipping of products from the warehouse to the store was seamless.
meanings.sent2: Global trade relies on efficient transshipping to reach diverse markets.
meanings.sent3: The children turned cleaning up their toys into a game of transshipping items around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like transshipping vessels, carrying stories from one listener to the next.
meanings.sent5: The transshipping of supplies to remote areas required careful planning and coordination.
